intro: Miconia huanucensis, commonly known as the Huanuco miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Peruvian Andes. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
